abstract: Michael S. Dell on Friday defended his $24.4 billion bid to buy control of Dell, arguing that an alternative proposal by Carl C. Icahn would severely weaken the computer company.
snippet: Michael S. Dell on Friday defended his $24.4 billion bid to buy control of Dell, arguing that an alternative proposal by Carl C. Icahn would severely weaken the computer company.
lead_paragraph: Michael S. Dell on Friday defended his $24.4 billion bid to buy control of Dell Inc., arguing that an alternative proposal by Carl C. Icahn would severely weaken the computer company.

headline.main: Michael Dell Defends His Leveraged Buyout Offer

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
